title.rendered: How to set up a new iPhone

content.rendered:
We’re giving you all the best tips on how to set up a new iPhone so that you can get started quicker than ever before when you receive your phone. From quick tips to longer walk throughs, we’re going to give you everything you need to know. You’ll be set up in no time!

How to set up a new iPhone

The first step you’ll have to do once you’ve turned on your mobile phone is select your language. This will make sure that the date and time is correct, and even how the home screen looks. After this, you’ll be asked to connect to your wifi. This is crucial in setting up your phone however, you can use your mobile data if easier. Once you’ve connected to an internet connection, the phone will update to make sure it’s working to its full potential.

Most iPhone’s that are currently available will allow you to set up Face ID or Touch ID. These both offer you super secure access to your mobile phone. You do have the option to set up just a passcode or even no security. We would highly advise that you do set up some sort of security on your mobile phone just to ensure your data stays safe.

From here, you can restore information through a number of different avenues. This includes the ability to restore data from an Android device. You can also choose to set the mobile phone up as an entirely new device if this is what you would like. You’ll then be asked to sign in to your Apple ID and approve a number of different features, such as Siri and automatic updates. Once you’ve accepted or declined these, you’ll be all set to go.

How to turn an iPhone on

Of course, turning on an iPhone is one of the first steps to knowing how to set up a new iPhone. It’s actually super easy to turn on a mobile phone. All you need to do is press and hold the power button. This is usually found on the side of the phone but can be found at the top on older devices. You need to hold this down until the Apple logo appears on the screen. You will also notice that the phone vibrates. At this point, you can let go of the button and the phone will turn on in a few seconds.

Using Quick Start

Quick Start is an Apple feature that means setting up your new feature so much easier than before. You’ll only be able to use Quick Start if you already have an old iPhone. With this, all you need to do is grab your current iPhone and unlock it. Place this close to your new iPhone and just wait for your new phone to connect. You’ll now get a few instructions on the screen. This just lets you know that the phone is syncing and will set up shortly.

You’re going to want to get your hands on a new phone now that you know exactly how to set up a new iPhone. View our iPhone deals to save money and find the perfect package. We’ll even offer free next day delivery do you can enjoy it quickly!
